reviews.sentence: We were very pleased with the ease of booking and the reception service when we arrived at the hotel. the check out was also friendly and efficient. The hotel location was excellent and we felt that the price was more reflective of the location than of the quality of the environment in the hotel rooms. The rooms felt a little shabby fro the price. We had drinks in the bar which we found very expensive but the service was very good and the staff were lovely.

Ok Stay. Although the hotel is very well located on the sea front the exterior resembles a concrete bunker. The rooms are a little on the small side but adequate. The service is very good from reception and breakfast serving staff. Breakfast offer is typical with continental offer with some hot options.

We arrived much later than expected having queued for 4 hours at the Folkestone terminal so we were very relieved to be in time for a bar meal. I would like to commend the bar staff for their friendliness and the speed of service. On arrival I had discovered that the 3 rooms I had booked for 3 nights were for sea view without balcony which was not very popular. However the reception staff were very helpful and we were able to change 2 of the rooms to with balcony after the first night. For the first night we were in room 120 which as you know looks straight at the exit from the bar to the beach. Because the opening window is at the right hand side it is not even possible to close the curtains for privacy. whilst keeping the window open. I really think the price of this room should be less than the other rooms of this type. I was pleased to read that you are undertaking a major refurbishment which includes the provision of air conditioning. This will be a big improvement. Nevertheless we all enjoyed our stay which is why we keep coming back.
great reception very helpful friendly people quality restauration nd comfortable room staff working hard to please the customer.

WE stayed for two nights. Reception staff were very polite and helpful. The bar area and restaurant area are well appointed with great views over the sea. We had a balcony room which was lovely a little cramped once the sofa bed was down. The shower room was again small but adequate. Was nt very keen on the seperate toilet area with no window or extraction system and no wash hand basin. Asked reception to supply a fan as the room was a little warm for us at night and they oblidged the next day with one which I was impressed with too.
Location good hotel very dated poor lounge facilities. Pool. Bedroom very dated. Bar closed at 11 pm they did not serve us.

Fantastic one night stay. Myself and the family really enjoyed our stay. We were only there one night for a bit of relaxation and to take in a bit of French culture etc. Reception bar and spa staff all extremely attentive and pleasant. No complaints whatsoever.

A decidedly average experience considering it cost over £ 300 for one night. Our experience in the hotel was okay it served the purpose of a stopover travelling from southern France back to England. My comments are as follows. Hotel kerb appeal Poor the building is well past it is best and does not look particularly inviting from the outside. The car park is insufficient for the size of the hotel with guests parking on the highway or down the road in a public car park. Welcome Very good staff on reception looked smart were very professional and attentive. Our Room Okay the hotel is very tired looking internally and this is reflected in the rooms walls were stained around air vents plus lots of other little things that add up to a lot refresh of rooms required. The room was clean beds comfortable facilities ie TV kettle were available. limited supply of tea coffee though. PAPER CUPS. NOT GOOD ENOUGH IN A HOTEL ROOM COSTING £ 150 night. Room was very hot and stuffy and proved difficult to sleep. AIR CONDITIONING required. Restaurant Evening meal Great food below average service long time waiting for attention food. Excellent breakfast good selection of food and plenty available. Bar Looks tired drinks expensive. Pool area Not really that special considering the beach side setting small changing area difficult access. This hotel could be a real jewel in the Novotel Crown. it has a fantastic location by the beach but is in desperate need of a refit to bring it up to current expectations. I would not recommend this to others as a place to stay for for more than one or two nights at most.

Let me down badly. I booked to stay at this hotel with my son this summer. we had stayed here before and enjoyed it so were looking forward to going back. We booked well in advance through Bokingscom. Having secured our accommodation I then booked our travel and attractions to enjoy during our holiday. A few weeks prior to our planned trip we were notified by bokingscom that the hotel had cancelled our booking as they had now let the room to someone else. Bokingscom offered us an alternative hotel at greater cost but this was unsuitable as it was not on the beach. I ended up having to make alternative arrangements myself which were not as good and had to pay a higher price as I was now booking much closer to our departure date. I never received any explanation why they had chosen to cancel my booking or any apology.

Great for a weekend choice or a longer stay. Spent 2 nights here in December 2018. Plus points very comfortable bed decent sized room with plenty of wardrobe space Nespreso machine bottled water both replenished each day. safe. Reception staff very friendly and helpful went out of their way to arrange transport to hotel when the weather was absolutely terrible. Had one evening meal in the restaurant which was excellent and has great views over the beach. Not so great Was surprised that a 4star hotel had a lovely bar that closed very early without warning. Went for a drink at 120 on a Saturday night to be told the bar was closed. Put a dampener on our evening and we all trouped off to bed early. The hotel is very warm hot. I presumed it was because it is a spa hotel but I was uncomfortably hot I the reception areas and our room even with the heating off in December. my only other issue was with the bizarre hairdryer in our room. Worked by touch sensor rather than switch so had to keep my thumb on it all the time difficult to manage and style the hair and I would think anyone with arthritis would find it impossible to use. However I really enjoyed my staff here and would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone for either a short break or a full week.

A fabulous experience for us all. We really enjoyed ourselves and had the best family time. I was a little apprehensive for being a lonely parent with my four young boys aged from 3 to 13 but the staff made it very easy and the facilities were already very set up for families and children. We had such a good time that we will come back again.

burning hot. we have been sleeping with open windows. the climatisation was not working. word of advice switch off the minibar to get cooler but from the talk I had later with the reception it looks like we make it up.

Very Good. Great place. Location is the best just 10 min walk to the town. Breakfast option was plentiful and only charged for the adults. Great buffet selection. ThoughLoves the terrace on the beach perfect for drinks. The restaurant food was ok but next time we ’d go out and eat. The staff were quite moody in the restaurant and although pool was good the changing facilities not so much beware it ’s salt water so my young kids did n’t like it much.

Our favourite hotel. We love the hotel and being on the beach the downstairs bar is great and the terrace is very good. Breakfasts in the dining room are excellent but the evening menu is not good for us especially as I am vegetarian. Also the coffee making facilites could be improved. A tiny pot of creamer each is just not adequate and the cardboeard cups are not good china ones would be much better and indeed I took one from the restaurant to use. The temporary access to the swimming pool was not ideal but that will hopefully be rectified by our next visit.

6 nights with 2 kids. Location right on the beach is wonderful. This is the best feature and walking to all that Le Touquet offers is easygoing even with kids. Staff is friendly but they are currently highly understaffed. This was especially noticeable in the restaurant bar. The saltwater pool was very nice. Be aware that the Thalasa Spa is under construction. This was disappointing and somewhat effects the layout of the pool entrance changing area and sunning lounge deck. Breakfast has a lot to offer no complaints. We spent 6 nights here in a single room with bunk beds for the kids. The room is much too small for 4 people our booking was last minute and there were no other options. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel to others while providing the above information small room understaffed spa renovation.

We had a very comfortable five nights stay with you. Excellent hotel and staff we had a very comfortable room with superb views of the sea. Facilities in the room were excellent as was the bathroom toilet. The restaurant and staff were also excellent and the food was very good. I had the best Rack of Lamb twice. that I have eaten in many years. We also found the prices of the restaurant very reasonable. This is the first time we have stayed in Novotel Le Touquet we normally stay in the IBIS next door but from now on we will be staying at the Novotel. One small point we did miss not having a comfortable lounge to sit in for an aperitif before our dinner. We ended up having our aperitif at the table which was OK. I know that there is a bar lounge down stairs but this appears to be more of a Beach Bar than a lounge. This did not spoil our stay at the hotel however and we will definitely return. Thank you.

Hotel renovation still not finished and worse service. Not very good. The renovation was unfinished meaning there was no gym or spa we could not walk through to the Ibis inside and there were still ugly builders cabins in the car park. None of this was mentioned on the web page. Also the new reception desk is too small the bar no longer serves evening meals and whoever thought it was a good idea to put a translucent piece of glass in the shower wall so people can be seen having a shower from outside should be fired immediately. We will not be coming back.

Facilities fine. but a mega mega mistake was made which ruined a happy occasion. Breakfast excelent location fantastic Had booked for five families nmely wife and self 4 of our issue and 10 gkids total 19 persons for wife s 80th. I was paying and clarified with reception as documents made this perfectly clear. Arriving in separate cars over a one hour period. BUT one family was requested to give cc guarantee of £ 70 and even worse having checked out and been told all in order I set off home that one family was told bill not paid and they could not leave till it was. I was half way up A16 when told this wife and I very upset as was family in question and we turned back on A16 for several miles before was phoned again to be told hotel had realised mistake. nevertheless we had. wasted time and money in having to set off back to return. It really spoiled what otherwise had been a nice stay.

got too busy. we love La Thalasa Le Touquet. since the pool is shared with IBIS it was too busy. over 100 people in it. Queues for breakfast were lengthy we could nt get a table until 10 am and we could not get a table for dinner on Friday night whuich was disapointing. The hotel is obviously doing very well but facilities are up to the volume of guests.

Very Good. Very clean and modern nice views of the sea. I think the property was fine a little hot at times in main areas I think staff could be more helpful particularly in reception no explanation of anything at all and very noisy dog barking during night checking out no one asked if we had enjoyed our stay and no one offered us any thing to do with the spa or pool yes could certainly have been more helpful the lady in the shop was absolutely delightful It is also a little way out of town.
